ygData.subject: Re: Re: What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: First off, I am not twinked, every thing I got I earned the money for myself.  As a monk this is really easy to do as monks dont have anything to spend money
ygData.messageBody:
First off, I am not twinked, every thing I got I earned the money for
myself. As a monk this is really easy to do as monks dont have anything to
spend money on but good armor. By the time I was 10th level, I had over 100
plat saved, by the time I reached 18th I had bought and sold over 1000 plat
worth of stuff, all done by money and items I have earned myself by selling
loot or trade skills. One good one is mesh. Poke your head into Guk and
you can just about get that stuff free off of the people in there....they
have it comming out of thier ears. I would also rather have things like a
spiked collar (easily obtainable in Black Burrow) than the cured silk
counterpart. Man, I give someone valuble information, such as the location
to where he can find a list of just about EVERY item a monk can wear, what
the stats are and more importantly where he can get them and how much they
usually sell for, so he can judge whether or not they are obtainable or not,
and you jump me with an offensive letter like this? Learn some manners.
What I am tired is, people like you jumping to conclutions when you have
absolutely no idea what you are talking about. The worst part is, I wasn't
insulting his armor, I was offering good, helpfull information. I never
said ANYTHING like "oh well cure silk is crap compaired to Shiverback, you
should get a full suit of that". If you knew anything, you yourself would
know there are little peices people can pick up here and there to improve
over something as rudimentary as cured silk is.
Anyway, do yourself a favor, think before you type...and maybe you should
check on stomped, you might find there is a peice of armor you could easily
replace with something better. Getting eq doesn't always involve camping
45+ mobs. Anyway.

Shelza, 18th, Karana.


>From: Clarity <roderick.duncan@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ-Monks] Re: What to buy?
>Date: Fri, 04 Feb 2000 11:42:10 -0500
>
>Shelza,
>
>I'm sorry, but what are you talking about? Herrick is a level 12 monk
>talking
>about saving up scarab carapaces for 1.7gp each! Do you think this guy has
>30pp to go buy a bracer of erolisi? or 100pp to get a silver-plated bracer?
>Please tell me what armor better than cured even a level 18 can go get?
>
>I'm just a little tired of people who are twinked telling new players what
>they
>should be wearing:
>
>"oh, man, that cured hat sucks, go get a froglock crown"
>
>There is a lot better stuff that Harrick can get, but he definitely
>shouldn't worry
>about it now. He has to get to 30 or so first.
>
>
>Clarity Harvestmoon,
>Karana
>
> >There is a TON of armor better than cured silk, I think the only place on
>my
> >monk that is still wearing cured is my Cured Silk Ghi (cause I just LOVE
>the
> >way my female monk looks wearing it) but every other location has a
>better
> >amrmor peice. Goto EQ Stomped and they have a special section on monk
>armor
> >and you can compare and contrast them, and see what you want to hunt for
> >next.
> >
> >Shelza, 18th Karana
> >
> >
> > >From: Andy Sands <andy.sands@...>
> > >Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
> > >To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
> > >Subject: [EQ-Monks] What to buy?
> > >Date: Wed, 02 Feb 2000 01:47:59 +0000
> > >
> > >Hi all,
> > >
> > >I'm a level 12 monk who now has a full set of cured and some wu's
> > >gauntlets. (It took long enough to save up)
> > >
> > >The thing is I don't have a clue what to buy next? The only better
>armour I
> > >know of is that Plane of Fear, Shiverback stuff.. At level 12, I think
>not.
> > >
> > >So I guess that leaves earrings and rings? What should I go for? I
> > >currently have no earrings and two +2 dex rings, + 1 AC derv rings..
> > >
> > >Any suggestions welcomed!
> > >
> > >PS I have discovered a useful (bug?) Scarab (sand/Giant) carapaces
>weigh
> > >0.0kgs. You can solo these at about level 10, and since the loot
>doesn't
> > >weigh anything it's all good! (Ok at higher levels 1.7gp per shell
>isn't
> > >going to get anyone very excited is it!)
> > >
> > >Cheers,
> > >
> > >Herrick of Quellious [Champions of Justice]
> > >Bristlebane
> > >
> > >--
> > >Anyone who is not a socialist at 16 has no heart,
> > >but anyone who still is at 32 has no mind.
> > >
> > >Mail me: andy.sands@...
> > >Url: http://www.manipulative.com/
>
